intro: Rinorea domatiosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Indian velvet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as an erect herb or shrub, often reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Rinorea domatiosa is often found in moist, shaded areas and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
